intro: ^Welcome to Hell, literally. (CLICK THIS BOX TO CONTINUE)
^Down here in the numberless realms where time is endless and death is cheap, the Dark Princes of Hell seek solace from eternity by any means necessary.

^Alas, Buer - your Dark Prince and long-term Employer, has grown bored and has decided to host a party (otherwise known as an excuse for a lot of tomfoolery, backstabbing, and machiavellian machinations).

^He expects to be amused as the factions of Hell vie for his favour, and as his Court Jester it is your tireless, thankless, truly awful task to make sure the event is as interesting as inhumanly possible.

s: ^Alas, you do not shoulder this burden alone.

c-0: ^You share this task with your rival, your nemesis, and the thorn in your proverbial side ever since your youthful days of busking on banks of the river Styx.
^Pan (Pandemonium to her enemies) is your Master's favourite little bloodhound, and together your shall compete for every morsel of attention that your master doles out. So you'd better act fast.
^ Of course we could work together...
^ But isn’t it so much more fun to compete against one another, consequences be damned?

tutorial: ^The party is underway, the plots are afoot, and rumours are rife. It's our job to sniff them out...together, you and me, and well...her.
^ The premise is simple: just prowl the party looking for juicy rumours to amuse your Lord.
^You do this by playing a version of the Devil's own game: roulette!
^There are 36 numbers on a roulette board - each one corresponding to a section of the party. In one (and only one) of them you will find a juicy tidbit that is sure to entertain your lord.

^You have 4 attempts to narrow down exactly where it is. You do this by 'betting' Confidence (the most important quality for any jester!) on one of the spaces surrounding the central numbers (by clicking on it) such as 1 to 12, Even, Odd, or one of the Rows (Top, Mid, Bot). Each corresponds to a set of numbers.

^Each guess you make will reveal or eliminate options from the board, narrowing down the possible locations. And guessing correctly nets you a return on invested Confidence, as well as a bonus cleared number!
^You can of course also go wild and take a stab at a singular number, but that might not be the most strategic!
^Once you have some fodder to work with (or not), it's time for a battle of wits with you-know-who.
^ Yes, that'd be me. Hope you're feeling lucky!
^ Let's start with an easy one: I hear Dracula's somewhere out among the guests. Let's go see what he's up to!

s0: ^This is it! You've found it! Haha! Let's see what's happening...
s1: ^Oh, you're hearing something very juicy here...
^You feel yourself closing in on some yummy gossip.
^No, it's not around here. But that's okay - process of elimination...
s2: ^Nothing wagered, nothing gained. Still, it stings...

b: ^ Time's up. Your mark is leaving.
^Time for a break. You are exhaused.
^You begin to hear whispers of a new rumour concerning your mark,
^. No rest for the wicked - time to go!

GameTheory: ^You have one opportunity left to choose and your opponent

s1: ^ might be able to help if you go to them.
s2: ^ could have some information to share.
s4: ^ could throw you a morsel of information if you ask nicely - can you ask nicely?
s5: ^ might know something on the down low.
s6: ^ could be open to a little information bartering.

b: ^ Look, I know we don't always see to eye. But maybe we should give this a go...
^ Give a what now? Where? Who? US?! As in...we?
^ You never know...it could be fun.
^ Let's try it out, and trust one another for once.
^ Oh right, ahem, yeah. That's what you meant. Obviously.
^ Back for more? Brave, aren't we?

Phase1: ^The game is simple: you both write down the numbers you have narrowed yourselves down to, and hand it to the other. After that, you can see what overlaps, and remove anything that doesn't. Except, of course, if you lie...
^Trust: tell her your actual remaining numbers. (You have narrowed it down to

s1: ^Surprise, surprise, the information she gave you was correct.
s2: ^Perhaps this cooperation "thing" isn't so bad, her information proved useful.
s3: ^Looks like this is a win/win situation, the info she gave you was useful.

s1: ^Look at the two of you, playing so well together.
s2: ^All this honest is starting to become a habit.
s3: ^You feel like you're building some real trust here.
s4: ^Who knew Pan could be so reliable. Maybe you've judged her too harshly for all these years.

s0: ^Unfortunately, your information wasn't! Alas, Pan can be vindictive when double-crossed like this. If you want her to trust you again you're going to have to put in the effort.
s1: ^You however chose the path of betrayal. It's okay, probably. You can grovel for forgiveness later.
s2: ^Too bad you lied to her, but she should have known better by now.
s4: ^The fact that she expects an ounce of honesty from you at this point is frankly astonishing.

s0: ^You get fake, useless information. She betrayed you!
s1: ^You compare the rooms, but soon realize none of them overlap with yours. She gave you fake information! The harridan!
s3: ^It doesn't take you long to realize the rooms she gave you are all rooms you've already discarded. She tricked you!
s4: ^You should have known better than to trust that IMP, the information she gave you was completely bogus.
s5: ^Argh! Curse this sudden yet inevitable betrayal, she has set you on a false trail.

s0: ^Of course, you betrayed her too, haha!
s2: ^Looks like neither of you are ready to share.
s4: ^Lying is a hard habit to break, let's give it one more try. I'll play nice, truly.

s2: ^You are Jesters in arms, striving to survive in this bleak Hellscape.

s0: ^We both betrayed each other, colour me shocked.
s1: ^Alas, alack, neither of you are to be trusted.
s2: ^You are both liars and con artists, was this outcome really surprising?
s3: ^Why do you both persist in this little dance, neither one of you is going to give the information away for free.

s0: ^I betrayed Pan's trust. But doesn't that make HER the fool?
s1: ^Once again, I am a cad, lying to my compatriot.
s3: ^Lying just comes so naturally to me, it really rolls of the tongue.
s4: ^I am a humble Judas, betrayer of gullible fools.
s5: ^Lies, upon lies, upon lies. She'll never trust me again.

s0: ^Pan has betrayed me! I am...unsurprised, honestly.
s2: ^Why do I keep doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results. Have I finally succumbed to madness?
s3: ^It's okay, I'll keep doing what I believe is right, even if no one else does.
s4: ^Betrayal, my old friend, we meet again!

s0: ^She clearly has no trust in you.
s2: ^You can't blame her for not trusting you.
s3: ^Unfortunately you've used up all her trust.
s4: ^It would seem Pandemonium's trust has limits.
s5: ^Trust schmust, you're here to win, not make friends.

s1: ^She doesn't seem to hold much stock in what you say.
^You need to work on your team-building.
s2: ^Pan still seems a little suspicious about your motivations.

b: ^She's suspicious of you so you are suspicious of her. Best not to risk giving her an advantage only to be stabbed in the back!

s1: ^Your rival's expression remains an impenetrable mask.
s2: ^Your rivals affections seem lukewarm at best.
s3: ^You are neither worth of your rival's suspicion, nor her trust. You are nothing to her.

s0: ^It seems she may trust you - just a smidgen.
s1: ^Baby steps, but you seem to be gaining her trust.
s2: ^You have a long way to go yet, but perhaps cooperation is possible.
s3: ^Are you imagining things, or is her smirk just a little less condescending?
s4: ^She seems to be warming to you...a little.

s1: ^The two of you are actually getting along, how strange.
s2: ^Why didn't you start trusting each other years ago?

s0: ^You have her full trust, it seems.
s1: ^It feels nice to have someone you can rely upon.
s2: ^Perhaps one day you could be friends.

InsultBattle: ^You approach the throne room, and your Dark Prince, Buer. Judging by the look on his face, he is

endBattle: ^ leaves the throne room, you glance at your Dark Prince.

b: ^He looks extremely bored with the proceedings. This does not bode well for your future job prospects.
^He looks bored. Clearly you were not very amusing.
^He does not look amused. Ack and alack...
^A small smile plays on his lips as he remembers some of your quips. Success..?
^He practically beams, a lion's hair's breadth from laughing. So close to success!
^Although it is slow at first, after a moment you are sure of it: he is laughing! He is actually laughing!
^Be as it may, your job is not yet done. Another dignitary is on their way to attend your lord. Time to find some dirt!
^ Let's see what we can do with little old Vlad here!.
^“Vhy do I feel like you are going to start mocking my accent?”

round_1: ^ Now, I should think of the perfect insult that will amuse my lord. Hmmm!

c-0: ^"Dracula, more like Dragula am I right?" Don't be gauche. They're demons, not Americans and that sort of humour won't get you anywhere.
c-1: ^You do a little riff on the different personality types who always show up at parties.

^ "There's always one that one guy who tries too hard, right? And look, I'm not naming any names, but all I'll say is I'm guy who decided to rock up to this party wearing a CAPE. No, shhhh, don't look! You know he doesn't like to be in the spotlight, it reminds him too much of the sun."
c-2: ^"I thought I had a drinking problem, but take a look at this guy!" You begin slowly, and build from there. After all you have enough fodder to roast this individual for days. You are on fire, you are a god, and by the time you are done even Dracula himself cannot suppress his toothy smile.

b: ^Pan smirks at you across the throne room, and you know you are done for. After all the subject matter is easy, the audience members practically fall into her hands. She is sharp, incisive, fresh. At the end Dracula comes up to her and shakes her hand. Wait, wasn't this an insult battle?
^Pan starts off with a dark quip about impaling people. It's a bit strong for the crowd, they haven't warmed up yet. Too bad. So sad.

endBattle: ^Dracula raises a glass to his host with a gracious smile.

b: ^ This is the real thing, so I better be on my toes! You don't know what's coming for you, Astaroth!

round_1: ^You try to think of what you learned about Astaroth in the beginning...

c-0: ^You make an underhanded comment about Asteroth's personal hygiene. Those jokes always work. Surely?
c-1: ^ "I would say we stand in fine company this night, but I have just noticed the presence of my lord amidst the crowd. I shall amend my statements accordingly."
c-2: ^ "What's with all the yarn you've been buying lately. Are you knitting together some new woolly political scheme, or did you just recently acquire a pet frost giant?"

b: ^Your rival expounds on the threads of fate that weave us all together, and how even the simplest yarn can have a purpose, and be used to strengthen the bonds between factions. Nonsense, frippery, but the crowd seems to like it.
^Your rival makes a derivative pun about cats and balls of yarn. A lone demon claps awkwardly from the back of the crowd as she takes her parting bow.

round_2: ^It is not over yet! Astaroth shifts uncomfortably, trying to remain dignified.

c-0: ^Make an ill-conceived joke about Asteroth being a math nerd. The numerous math nerds in the crowd are less than impressed.
c-1: ^ "Please let us converse no longer, I would preserve my wit for those who have the acumen to appreciate it fully."
c-2: ^ "Tell us, what wisdom did the soul of this damned grandmother impart? Are the knots a euphemism for something perhaps, or have you stumbled across a new hobby?"

b: ^Your rival expounds on the virtues of working with one's hands, and suggests that one must be sharp of wit to wield a needle with acumen.
^Your rival starts a mildly diverting tangent on knitting needles, but loses her train of thought halfway through and gets tangled up in her own words. Unfortunate.

round_3: ^The audience is drawing to a close. Astaroth is desperately trying to keep his cool.

c-0: ^You draw an unfavourable comparison between the size of the crown on Asteroth's head, and other body parts that they may or may not possess. The crowd doesn't get it.
c-1: ^Make up something about Asteroth's love for handicrafts, highlight the silly contrast between such cutesy pursuits and the otherwise severe reputation of the leader of Serpent House.
c-2: ^Highlight the ludicrous concept of Asteroth, Prince of Hell, one of the Evil Trinity, Lord of the profane and unholy...knitting little hats for strangers. How did this come to pass? Is this a Demon Lord who stands before us, or some paltry imposter? How weak, how laughable. The crowd it seems would agree.

b: ^Your rival weaves together a touching, heartfelt tale about the lonely demons who guard the frozen outer realms. By the end of her speech even you have a tear in your eye. Off to one side you hear a Duke of Hell sniffle and remark to their companion, "wasn't it so kind of him, to knit them such warm and lovely hats."
^Your rival tells a generic joke to a smattering of polite laughter. You turn to one side to hide your smirk.

endBattle: ^Astaroth walks away, their face an expressionless mask.

b: ^Naberius approaches. Two out of three of his heads ignore you.

round_1: ^You consider which head to direct your insult at.

c-0: ^Make a silly joke about Naberius' hoarse voice, and suggest he should spend less time debating, and more time gargling.
c-1: ^ "I would speak well of you if given half the chance, but alas nothing comes to mind."
c-2: ^What could such an upstanding demon be doing on the mortal plane? The frequency of his visits suggest a juicy secret waiting to be uncovered, and you make sure the crowd has many wild possibilities to ponder.

b: ^There are many reasons why demons travel to the mortal realm, and in Pan's hands all of them seem equally hilarious. The crowd laughs, the crowd weeps. You cannot even hold it against them.
^Your rival starts off with a Cerberus allusion and Is quickly silenced by booing. This crowd does NOT like being compared to Tartarus. You make a mental note.

round_2: ^Naberius's facade of dignity is beginning to crack!

c-1: ^ "I have been known on occasion to refer to myself as a fool, but it seems churlish to do so now when in the presence of one so truly foolish."
c-2: ^Just what is it that Naberius the valiant is smuggling into his household in such large burlap sacks? You leave the details to the imagination of your audience, but make sure to draw some amusing connections between several unsavoury pursuits that Naberius is widely known to look down upon. It seems to go over well with the crowd.

b: ^Your rival has a nigh limitless supply of quips about the various objects one can smuggle in sacks, and amusing methods for identifying them. It's a silly joke, but it works.
^Pan's jibes start poorly, raise to passable in the middle, and then fall flat with all the grace of a popped balloon. Bad joke or just a tough crowd. Both.  Yes, both.

round_3: ^He is wavering, he is about to crack. Only one head refuses to look away.

c-0: ^Make a snide comment about Naberius' canine attributes and suggest he is in need of a dog treat.
c-1: ^ "Please save us from your rhetoric, you may think it is your wit that makes us fall prey to your arguments, but alas it is the foulness of your breath that is the true leveller in this hall."
c-2: ^ "What's this, a reversal in fortunes? On the mortal plane it is mankind who keeps their canine compatriots as pets, but here in Hell our own faithful Naberius has turned the tables and now takes in stray humans? What perverse fetish is this? And from such a renowned and dignified figure? How pitiful, how base, how unclean."

b: ^Your rival takes all the elements of the story that you would have mocked, and turns them into assets. Her jokes are gracious, AND funny, and highlight the spirit of Naberius' goodwill.
^Pan makes a sad joke about fleas. To think, this is the person you compete with.

endBattle: ^Naberius walks away with his proverbial tail between his legs.

b: ^You wonder if this is a good idea. The cat will be a fierce foe. But! You have a lord to amuse...

round_1: ^Byleth looks at you, haughty and imperious.

c-0: ^ "Have you heard the joke about the cat and the hairball? Anyone? Nope?"
c-1: ^ "Please, let us not tarry together much longer, your presence lingers on the mind like the aftertaste of old vinegar."
c-2: ^ "I'm sure everyone here knows by now that bringing up Byleth's trumpet playing is a surefire way to get clawed across the face. Pity the old cat can't take a joke. His music certainly can though..."

b: ^ "What's this, Byleth gets touchy when you talk about his trumpet?"
^You rival winks at the crowd, and embarks on one of the lewdest, wildest jokes you ever heard. By the end of it even Byleth is laughing.
^Your rival's joke veers dangerously close to the brink of silliness, and then teeters abruptly over the edge of absurdity. You flinch in sympathy.

round_2: ^The cat harrumphs and shakes himself. Maybe you've gotten under his skin, despite it all?

c-0: ^Make some asinine jest about cat litter. I mean really even you are embarrassed, he only looks like a cat.
c-1: ^ "Thou hast the complexion of cream; as pale as a loon, and somewhat curdled."
c-2: ^ "Numerous little birds have told me that Byleth was recently seen reading copious amounts of sheet music. Alas, the little birds couldn't tell me anything further, as Byleth caught and ate every one of them."

b: ^Your rival turns the subject matter into music, playing the attention of the crowd as though there were strings upon the fiddle of her wit. You're supposed to compete with this?
^Alas, your rivals riposte is less music to the ears, and more like the yowling of tomcats. Ouch.

round_3: ^It looks like the demon has had enough. He is about to leave!

c-0: ^ "Heaven may have a choir of angels, but we have a cacophony of cats! Or...cat. Singular."
c-1: ^It is said none can rival you upon the battlefield, for you are ever first at the scene, and then scarcely after the confrontation has begun, you are once again the first to leave!
c-2: ^The rumour mill says that Byleth recently started taking lessons from the famous Orpheus, the bard of the underworld himself! Alas, even such a famous tutor can't compensate for being tone deaf. Poor Byleth, I'm afraid that ship has sailed. Maybe try something more suited to your talents, like terrifying clergymen or chasing mice?

b: ^Whatever story you spun, she does it better, with far fewer cat puns and far more incisive witticisms. The crowd laps it up like the proverbial cat with the cream. Oh god, you just can't stop can you?
^Your rivals joke is as tone-deaf as Byleth himself.

MakeHimLaugh: ^ You amuse me, little jester. I am amused. You have made me laugh this day.
OutOfContent: ^ I remain bored, little jester, even after all our guests are gone. How boring.
^You have lost the game - you ran out of time to make him laugh!
MakeHimAngry: ^ Enough of your lackluster prattle and useless wit! I will have more entertainment out of eating you than listening to you!
^You have lost the game - you managed to make him angry!

DraculaBio: ^He is Dracula, obviously. What, you didn't expect to see Dracula here? Why not, that's elitist. Why wouldn't Dracula be at this party? Indeed, can a party even be called such if Dracula is not present? Just look at him, magnificent.
AstarothBio: ^Astaroth, Heirarch of Serpent House, one of the Trinity of Evil (as he likes to remind everyone at every possible juncture), Lord of laziness, vanity, and philosophy. A bit of a math nerd. Bit of a dick.
NaberiusBio: ^Naberius, a valiant Marquis of Hell. Dignified, eloquent, a bit stuck up but generally amiable and likeable sort of guy. Definitely not related to Cerberus, stop asking. Gosh. And it's NABERIUS, not "Nabbers".
BylethBio: ^Byleth of the Order of Flies. A mighty and terrible warlord of Hell. Plays cacophonous music to terrify his foes. Treats everyone with disdain. Can be easily distracted bit of feather on a string. Tickle his tummy at your peril.

b: ^Likes a bit of the red from time to time, if you know what we mean.
^Astaroth was seen purchasing numerous bags of yarn.
^Astaroth was caught discussing the finer points of knitting with a damned soul.
^Astaroth gave out knitted hats to the guard-demons in the frozen wastelands, because he thought they "looked a bit chilly".
^Naberius was seen visiting the mortal plane on numerous occasions.
^Naberius was seen smuggling large sacks into their residence.
^Naberius has a soft spot for unlucky human souls, and likes to rehabilitate them.
^Byleth gets upset if you comment on their trumpet playing.
^Byleth was seen reading sheet music in secret.
^Byleth was seen consorting with Orpheus in the underworld.

s0: ^While you are at it, it might be worth taking a look over here...
s1: ^You didn't hear it from me, but this section is more likely to bear fruit than others.
s2: ^Word on the grapevine says that you should focus you efforts in certain directions.
s3: ^This section of the party is looking particularly interesting, better investigate.

b: ^ You decide to step by the bar before starting.
^You abscond to the bar to catch your breath.

Barfly_Encounters: ^ The barfly regards you with a thousand faceted eyes.
^ Well, it's been fun. Time to get back to it!

Talk1: ^All that talking has made you thirsty. You gesture to the Barfly for a drink.
^"One of your finest glasses of water please!"

c-0: ^The Barfly's sensory ganglions twitch in surprise.
^You level a wink at him. "I never drink on the job."
^ "Hmm, come to think of it I've never seen an off-duty Jester."
^ "Yes, this job does demand most of one's time."
^"Alas it's been 263 years since my last holiday. But what can you do, right? Hell isn't known for it's enlightened employment practices.
c-1: ^The Bar-fly shakes his head, lights refracting from his eyes like the surface of a grungy disco ball.
^ "Hard liquor is reserved exclusively for the guests, by order of the Host."

c-0: ^You feel a sudden burning sensation on the back of your neck and sneak a glance over your shoulder to make sure Lord Buel hasn't snuck up behind you.
^He's suprisingly stealthy for a giant terrifying lion head surrounded by eldritch wings - but thankfully (this time) he is nowhere to be seen.

g-0: ^The Bar-Fly hands you a murky glass of water.

c-0: ^ You raise the glass to the neon light of the bar sign and gaze mournfully into its depths.
^ "This water is opaque. In fact it's practically a solid. Where did you get it, Ankh-Morpokh?"
c-1: ^ "It's been several centuries since I last tasted proper liquor, but if I close my eyes I can almost rem--- ack. Ugh. Oh god. What is this, bilge water?!"

g-0: ^ The Bar-Fly looks at you. Looks at the glass. Looks back at you. And shrugs.
^ "Right, gotcha. It's better not to ask."

Talk2: ^You return to the bar, a little wearier, a little wiser.

^Now that you have had another look at him the Barfly does look awfully familiar. Could it be that you've seen him at another party somewhere? Lesser demons come and go, but perhaps... No, a Greater Demon wouldn't be tending the bar in a place like this...surely.

c-0: ^ The Barfly gives a noncommittal shrug with one of his many shoulders.
^ "Say no more, friend. We understand one another completely."
c-1: ^You spot her a few stools down, nursing something bright and poisonous looking in a tall martini glass. No bilge water for Miss Pandemonium. No sir.
^"Yes well, just think of it as an unfortunate accident. Like a car crash or a heart attack."
^"You do like to spring up out of nowhere."
^"Please, I think you'll find that I was here first."
^"AHEM." The Barfly levels you with a look - or does he, it's really quite hard to tell, and resumes wiping the bar with a dirty rag.
^Both you and Pandemonium get the hint, and lower your heads like chastised children. No arguing at the Bar, got it.

c-0: ^ Pan smirks, and downs the rest of her drink. "Indeed. And put in some effort this time will you, it's MEANT to be a competition."

g-0: ^ "Oh well, guess it's time to get back out there!"

Talk3: ^You are taking a break by the bar when you notice a suspicious figure lurking nearby.

c-0: ^The representative for Serpent House wags his serpentine tail and joins you at the bar.
^It quickly becomes clear that Serpent House wishes to make an alliance. Their envoy isn't much of a negotiator, but what he lacks in acumen he makes up for with fluffiness.
^ "So what do you say? Are you willing to turn a blind eye here and elevate us in Lord Buer's favour?"
^ After all why not. Why shouldn't you say yes to this nice fluffy demon. It's not like it will hurt anyone.
^You catch sight of the look in Marchosias serpentine half's eyes, and try to resist the urge to pat him on his head.
c-1: ^ "I know I appear to be little more than a Motley Fool, but I know my own worth. Sweeten the deal a little and I'll...consider it."
^What do you really owe your lord anyway? He doesn't even let you take any holidays.
^Marchosias seems a bit ruffled, but he hands over a bribe as requested. You feel a boost of confidence wash over you.
c-2: ^ He's awfully eager, so you try to let him down gently. You give him a lot of spiel about company loyalty, fearing for you life, and besmirching the honour of jesters. He laps it all up.
^Marchosias leaves the bar, ears flattened with dejection. Pity, he seemed like such a good boy. You hope Asteroth won't treat his failure too badly.

c-1: ^"I'm not in the market today for any snake-oil salesman spiel,.Please move along."
^You are awfully busy and important after all. Can't they tell just from looking at you?
^For whatever reason, this tactic seems to work, and the figure depart looking a little non-plussed.

Talk12: ^This is an example, please delete or comment out.
^ This option will be greyed out in-game if you do not have at least 50 confidence.
^ We use the same syntax, even if all we do is increase approval...
^ We use the same syntax, even if all we do is increase approval...

c-0: ^We remove confidence and then do fun things.
c-2: ^We've now increased fly approval I guess!
c-3: ^We've now increased snake approval I guess!

FinalTalk: ^DEBUG: Move this talk up in the list and leave it as the final one if no other talks are forthcoming.
